definition: lit. don't worry about not knowing goods, but about comparing them (proverb)/fig. goods' (or person's) true value can only be determined through comparison
pinyin: bu4 pa4 bu4 shi2 huo4 , zhi3 pa4 huo4 bi3 huo4
containing_words.word: 不怕不識貨，只怕貨比貨

definition: lit. don't worry about not knowing goods, but about comparing them (proverb)/fig. goods' (or person's) true value can only be determined through comparison
pinyin: bu4 pa4 bu4 shi2 huo4 , jiu4 pa4 huo4 bi3 huo4
containing_words.word: 不怕不識貨，就怕貨比貨

sentences.english: To cast pearls before swine is to give things of value to those who will not understand it.
sentences.chinese: 明珠投暗的意思，就是把珍貴的東西送給不識貨的人。

sentences.english: It's so delicacies that beguile even the most discerning gourmet .
sentences.chinese: 這是即使最識貨的美食家也會着迷的美味佳餚。

sentences.english: Adiscerning connoisseur would have found the vase a fake .
sentences.chinese: 一個識貨的鑑賞家本會發現這個古瓶是贗品。

sentences.english: Connoisseurs can order a six-pack at onlinestore.smucker.
sentences.chinese: 識貨的人能通過網上商店定購一份六盒裝的。

definition: friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
cheating neither old nor young (idiom); treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously/Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.
to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
loved by all/to have universal appeal
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
